insights.text: Walk-forward validation is the only reliable predictor of live performance. In-sample Sharpe alone is meaningless.
MIN year Sharpe is the binding constraint for strategy quality — average Sharpe can be misleading if one year collapses.
Static ensemble weights outperform adaptive/dynamic weights. Regime-switching adds complexity without improving robustness.
Signal exhaustion is real — after 100+ parameter combinations, marginal improvements become noise. Know when to stop.
Expected live Sharpe = 50-60% of backtest Sharpe after execution costs, slippage, and market impact.
Orthogonality paradox: truly independent signals are hard to find within the same market microstructure.

lessons: In-sample breakthrough + walk-forward failure = classic overfitting trap
Cost models must be realistic from day 1 — optimistic costs invalidate all conclusions
Survivorship bias (using current symbols on historical data) inflates early-period metrics

_meta.description: Universal trading wisdom — applies to ALL markets and projects
